intro: Pleurothyrium amapaense, commonly known as the Amapa palm, is a species of flowering plant in the family Arecaceae. It is native to the Amazon rainforest, specifically found in parts of northern Brazil. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and pinnately compound leaves. It produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in panicles, which are followed by dark blue, fleshy fruits. This species plays an important ecological role in its habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife.
